intro: Coccoloba totnea, commonly known as the Jamaican hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically green with a slightly hairy texture. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in clusters. The plant is often used in traditional medicine and is also cultivated for its ornamental value.
